name: itmemory
title: Tab Memory Usage
description: Tab Memory Usage displays the amount of memory is used by each tab
author: Jeremy Schomery

preferences.name: mode
preferences.title: Memory report mode:
preferences.description: Inside: Memory report is appended to the actual title element. Outside: Memory report is placed inside a new element (similar to sound notification). Toolbar: Display memory usage inside a toolbar button badge. Wait for a few seconds for the change to take place.

preferences.name: begin
preferences.title: Color code for Memory usage 0% (only for toolbar mode):
preferences.description: Percent is calculated by dividing memory usage to 50Mbytes

preferences.name: end
preferences.title: Color code for Memory usage l00%  (only for inside mode):
preferences.description: Percent is calculated by dividing memory usage to 50Mbytes

preferences.name: position
preferences.title: Memory report position (only for inside mode):
preferences.description: This is where memory report is positioned relative to the title. Wait for a few seconds for the change to take place.

preferences.name: delimiter
preferences.title: Memory report delimiter (only for inside mode):
preferences.description: This symbol is used to separate memory report from title.  Wait for a few seconds for the change to take place.
If you usually have many open tabs, prolong the time interval. Note that memory calculation is not taking place if tab is idle.
preferences.name: delay
preferences.title: Minimum time interval between memory calculations for a single tab (in seconds):

preferences.name: exceptions
preferences.title: Exception list (comma separated):
preferences.description: Do not append memory usage to the tabs with URLs matching this list. Memory usage is appended to the title of each document. Some websites use this title later to generate a new title. This will cause accumulation of memory usage on the title bar.
After each upgrade by default the extension opens its welcome page to notify user about the recent changes
